message.content:
A 'Viola sempervirens', commonly known as the evergreen violet, is a perennial flowering plant in the family Violaceae. 
It typically grows to a height of 10-20 cm and has glossy dark green leaves that remain evergreen throughout the year. 
The flowers of the 'Viola sempervirens' are typically purple-blue and have five petals with a distinct white center. 
The blooms appear between March and June and have a light sweet fragrance. 
This plant is commonly found in rocky habitats, crevices, and slopes along the Mediterranean coasts of Europe and North Africa. 
It is a popular choice for rock gardens, border edging, and ground cover. 
The 'Viola sempervirens' is also considered a medicinal herb and has been used traditionally to treat headaches and coughs.
